hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I'm afraid that number's ex-directory mutant bcaa caps 400 But it nearly never got made at all. Creator Vince Gilligan, a warm, avuncular 46-year-old Virginian with perfect formal manners, came up with the idea while mulling over his own prospects in the television industry as he reached his forties and The X-Files, the hit show for which he was a writer and executive producer, came to the end of its run. He and a friend joked about buying a camper van and cooking meth for a living, and a character started to form in his mind. “It’s not that I came up with Breaking Bad as a show as much as I came up with Walter White as a character,” he tells me over tea in hotel, “and realised that I could tell a story about him that would fill a TV series.”
